title: Ticket #1922: crash in IPVerify::Verify when DNS returns NULL for host aliases
description:
The OSG glidein factory observed collector crashes with the following stack dump: 

condor_collector(_ZN8IpVerify6VerifyE12DCpermissionPK11sockaddr_inPKcP8MyStringS7_+0x3c0)[0x8155244]
condor_collector(_ZN6SecMan6VerifyE12DCpermissionPK11sockaddr_inPKcP8MyStringS7_+0x28)[0x815e17c]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore6VerifyEPKc12DCpermissionPK11sockaddr_inS1_+0x4a)[0x81223e6]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore9HandleReqEP6StreamS1_+0x8b4)[0x8124c54]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore24CallSocketHandler_workerEibP6Stream+0x324)[0x8123d84]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore35CallSocketHandler_worker_demarshallEPv+0x1d)[0x8123a51]
condor_collector(_ZN13CondorThreads8pool_addEPFvPvES0_PiPKc+0x27)[0x81c947b]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore17CallSocketHandlerERib+0xbf)[0x8123893]
condor_collector(_ZN10DaemonCore6DriverEv+0xf98)[0x8123524]
condor_collector(main+0xbbc)[0x813429c]
/lib/tls/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xd3)[0xb76e93]

The line where it is crashing appears to be this: 

thehost = *(aliases++);

I believe aliases must be NULL or uninitialized.

This bug may be much older than 7.5.5. I haven't investigated to see how old it is. The conditions that could lead to this problem are slightly different in the new IPv6 code, so it is possible that the problem was introduced in 7.5.4 when the IPv6 code went in.
remarks:
2011-Feb-21 16:50:00 by danb:
I did further analysis of the problem at UCSD. The problem appears to be triggered by sporadic DNS failures. condor_gethostbyname_ipv6() does two lookups, one to getaddrinfo() and one to gethostbyname(). If the former succeeds but the latter fails, this could result in aliases being NULL in IpVerify::Verify().
